chunks.zh: 从童年保留至今的阴影：“去敬一圈酒”
chunks.en: A shadow kept from childhood: 'Go make a toast to everyone'

chunks.zh: 大年初一的时候和亲戚吃饭，一大桌子人除了我和几个平辈（二十来岁）就都是长辈（五六十岁）。
chunks.en: On the first day of the Lunar New Year, I had dinner with relatives. At a large table, apart from me and a few peers (in their twenties), everyone else was an elder (in their fifties or sixties).

chunks.zh: 吃到一大半，我妈凑过来跟我说让我去敬一圈酒，就是挨个和桌上每家人喝一杯，说句身体健康万事如意啥的。
chunks.en: Halfway through the meal, my mom leaned over and told me to go around and make a toast to everyone, which meant drinking a glass with each family at the table and saying something like 'good health and all the best'.

chunks.zh: 本来不是难事，但就让人很不爽，我从大概小学开始每次参加聚餐我妈必让我做这件事，小时候敬的是饮料，桌上所有小孩都要被自己父母撺掇敬酒，还要比谁说得好听，一桌大人跟看表演一样。
chunks.en: It wouldn't have been difficult, but it was very annoying. Since elementary school, every time I attended a dinner gathering, my mom insisted that I do this. When I was a kid, I toasted with drinks, and all the kids at the table were encouraged by their parents to make a toast, and they even had to compete to see who could say it the nicest, and the adults at the table watched as if it were a performance.

chunks.zh: 更让我不爽的是，经我妈这一撺掇我里外不是人，如果我去敬酒，就是非要老妈提醒才去敬酒，而且感觉像在表演很不自然。
chunks.en: What annoyed me even more was that with my mom's encouragement, I was stuck in an awkward position. If I went to make a toast, it seemed like I only did it because my mom reminded me, and it felt unnatural like I was performing.

chunks.zh: 如果我不去，那就更不懂事了，让你敬酒你还不敬。
chunks.en: If I didn't go, then it would be even more impolite, as if I was being asked to make a toast and I wouldn't.

chunks.zh: 但反过来在她眼里，如果她不提醒我我肯定不会敬酒，她提醒我之后我至少去敬了。
chunks.en: But conversely, in her eyes, if she didn't remind me, I definitely wouldn't make a toast, and after she reminded me, at least I went.

chunks.zh: 当然她想的也没错，她不来撺掇我我肯定不会去做这种事。
chunks.en: Of course, she wasn't wrong, if she didn't encourage me, I definitely wouldn't do such a thing.

chunks.zh: 虽然能理解这种事，在饭桌上敬个酒也相当于活跃活跃气氛，但就是很不爽，很童年阴影
chunks.en: Although I can understand that this kind of thing, making a toast at the dinner table is equivalent to enlivening the atmosphere, it's just very annoying, a childhood shadow.

chunks.zh: 买个水枪挨个 ci
chunks.en: Buy a water gun and squirt everyone

chunks.zh: 同学 你过年这几天都不肯演 职场里又如何演的下去
chunks.en: Classmate, if you're not willing to perform during these Spring Festival days, how will you manage to perform in the workplace?

chunks.zh: 「虽然能理解这种事，在饭桌上敬个酒也相当于活跃活跃气氛」-----说句难听的，你其实跟他们是一类人。
chunks.en: 'Although I can understand that this kind of thing, making a toast at the dinner table is equivalent to enlivening the atmosphere' ----- To put it bluntly, you are actually one of them.

chunks.zh: 我从小就是直接拒绝的
chunks.en: I have always refused directly since I was a child.

chunks.zh: 有啥大了不起的事儿。
chunks.en: What's the big deal?

chunks.zh: 去就去，敬酒无非是说点好话，人家再回几句好话。
chunks.en: Just go. Toasting is just saying some nice things, and people will say some nice things back.

chunks.zh: 实在不想说也没问题。
chunks.en: It's okay if you really don't want to say anything.

chunks.zh: 实际上敬不敬也无所谓， 人家不会因为敬了他，就看高你一分。
chunks.en: In reality, it doesn't matter whether you toast or not. People won't think highly of you because you toasted them.

chunks.zh: 一切的一切还是在于自身的实力。
chunks.en: Everything still depends on your own strength.

chunks.zh: 自身实力强了，想如何就如何。
chunks.en: If you have strong personal strength, you can do whatever you want.

chunks.zh: 耍几次酒疯，就没人叫你了
chunks.en: Throw a few drunken tantrums, and no one will ask you to do it again.

chunks.zh: > 当然她想的也没错，她不来撺掇我我肯定不会去做这种事。虽然能理解这种事，在饭桌上敬个酒也相当于活跃活跃气氛，但就是很不爽，很童年阴影@V2April 你这个想法我也有过，后来我琢磨了一下，这就是认知缺陷导致的服从性测试（简单理解为就是别人这么干我也这么干），我顺便问了下 AI：这种情况可以从心理学的几个角度来解释：权力和控制：施加者可能通过让你做你不愿意做的事情来获得一种控制感或权力感。
chunks.en: > Of course, she wasn't wrong, if she didn't encourage me, I definitely wouldn't do such a thing. Although I can understand that this kind of thing, making a toast at the dinner table is equivalent to enlivening the atmosphere, it's just very annoying, a childhood shadow @V2April I've had this thought too. Later, I thought about it a bit, and this is a compliance test caused by cognitive defects (simply put, it's doing what others do). I also asked an AI: This situation can be explained from several psychological angles: Power and control: The imposer may gain a sense of control or power by making you do things you don't want to do.

chunks.zh: 心理学中，这种行为可能与权力距离或支配性行为有关。
chunks.en: In psychology, this behavior may be related to power distance or dominant behavior.

chunks.zh: 有些人通过控制他人来提升自己的自尊或满足某种心理需求。
chunks.en: Some people boost their self-esteem or satisfy certain psychological needs by controlling others.

chunks.zh: 社会规范和文化压力：在许多文化中，过年敬酒是一种重要的社交礼仪，尤其是在团圆或庆祝的场合。
chunks.en: Social norms and cultural pressure: In many cultures, toasting during the Lunar New Year is an important social etiquette, especially during reunions or celebrations.

chunks.zh: 施加者可能认为这是文化或社交的必需，即使知道你不愿意，也出于对传统或社会期望的遵循而坚持让你参与。
chunks.en: The imposer may consider this a cultural or social necessity, and even if they know you don't want to, they insist on you participating out of adherence to tradition or social expectations.

chunks.zh: 忽视他人界限（ Boundary Violation ）：施加者可能缺乏对个人界限的尊重或理解。
chunks.en: Ignoring Other People's Boundaries (Boundary Violation): The imposer may lack respect or understanding for personal boundaries.

chunks.zh: 心理学上，这可能显示出他们对情感智力（ Emotional Intelligence ）的缺失，特别是在识别和尊重他人感受和需求方面。
chunks.en: Psychologically, this may indicate a lack of emotional intelligence, especially in identifying and respecting the feelings and needs of others.

chunks.zh: 认知失调：施加者可能认识到你的不情愿，但由于认知失调的现象，他们可能会合理化自己的行为，认为这是“为了大家好”或“这是传统”，以减轻自己施压于你的内疚感。
chunks.en: Cognitive Dissonance: The imposer may recognize your unwillingness, but due to the phenomenon of cognitive dissonance, they may rationalize their behavior, thinking it's 'for everyone's good' or 'this is tradition' to alleviate their guilt from pressuring you.

chunks.zh: 强迫性行为：如果这种行为重复发生，且施加者在被告知后依然坚持，这可能涉及到某种程度的强迫性人格特质或行为模式，表现为对特定行为的执着或强迫他人遵从。
chunks.en: Compulsive Behavior: If this behavior occurs repeatedly, and the imposer insists even after being told, it may involve some degree of obsessive-compulsive personality traits or behavioral patterns, manifested as an obsession with specific behaviors or compulsiveness to force others to obey.

chunks.zh: 沟通障碍：可能存在沟通不畅的情况。
chunks.en: Communication Obstacles: There may be a lack of clear communication.

chunks.zh: 你的反馈可能没有被有效地传达或被施加者理解为不重要的，或者他们可能误解了反馈的严重性。
chunks.en: Your feedback may not have been effectively conveyed or understood by the imposer as unimportant, or they may have misunderstood the severity of the feedback.

chunks.zh: 在这种情况下，你可以考虑采取以下策略：明确沟通：再次明确地表达你的不情愿，解释为什么这个行为令你不适，尽量避免情绪化，使用“我”陈述（如“我感到不舒服”而不是“你让我不舒服”）。
chunks.en: In this case, you may want to consider the following strategies: Clear Communication: Express your unwillingness again clearly, explain why this behavior makes you uncomfortable, try to avoid being emotional, and use 'I' statements (such as 'I feel uncomfortable' instead of 'you make me uncomfortable').

chunks.zh: 设置界限：坚定但礼貌地拒绝，提出其他可接受的替代方案，比如敬酒可以用其他方式表达祝福。
chunks.en: Set Boundaries: Firmly but politely refuse, propose other acceptable alternatives, such as toasting can express blessings in other ways.

chunks.zh: 寻求支持：如果情况不变，考虑从家庭或朋友那里获得支持，或者在必要时寻求专业的心理咨询帮助处理这种人际关系中的压力。
chunks.en: Seek Support: If the situation doesn't change, consider getting support from family or friends, or seeking professional psychological counseling to help deal with the stress in this interpersonal relationship.

chunks.zh: 心理学的解释可以帮助理解这种行为的动机，但改变这种动态可能需要双方都进行反思和调整。
chunks.en: Psychological explanations can help understand the motives behind this behavior, but changing this dynamic may require both parties to reflect and adjust.

chunks.zh: 其实现在也能理解了。
chunks.en: Actually, I can understand it now.

chunks.zh: 亲戚朋友在传统社会的作用就是保险公司。
chunks.en: The role of relatives and friends in traditional society is like an insurance company.

chunks.zh: 如果你遇到重大变故或者别的啥需要筹钱的事，你敬酒就相当于每年交一次保费。
chunks.en: If you encounter major changes or other things that require fundraising, toasting is equivalent to paying an annual premium.

chunks.zh: @livid #35 全是 ad
chunks.en: @livid #35 All ads

chunks.zh: 很多所谓的人情世故礼节和风俗，其实都是近几十年才出现的
chunks.en: Many so-called social niceties, etiquettes, and customs have only appeared in recent decades.

chunks.zh: 实在不行，就和老妈说好，我就不愿意去了。
chunks.en: If it really doesn't work, tell your mom that you just don't want to go.

chunks.zh: 然后就坚决不去吃饭。
chunks.en: Then resolutely don't go to dinner.

chunks.zh: 自己的生活自己做主。
chunks.en: Take charge of your own life.

chunks.zh: 过年直接不回家呗，多简单的事啊！
chunks.en: Just don't go home for the New Year, it's that simple!

chunks.zh: 如果工作地点和父母同城，那就换个远点的城市。
chunks.en: If your job is in the same city as your parents, then move to a farther city.

chunks.zh: 自己先喝两杯..然后再去兜一圈..感觉会好很多。
chunks.en: Have a couple of drinks yourself first... then go around... it will feel much better.

chunks.zh: 就是大人不尊重你，不用找别的理由
chunks.en: It's just that adults don't respect you, no need to look for other reasons.

chunks.zh: 其实我们每个人都是演员，敬酒只不过是一种社交而已，你就假装表演一下啦
chunks.en: Actually, we are all actors. Toasting is just a kind of social interaction. Just pretend to perform.

chunks.zh: 这个也是我的噩梦之一，小时候最恐怖的就是代替爸妈去吃酒席，一圈人我都不认识，各种礼仪还一大堆，各种不自在。
chunks.en: This is also one of my nightmares. When I was a kid, the scariest thing was going to banquets on behalf of my parents. I didn't know anyone, and there were all kinds of etiquette, which made me very uncomfortable.

chunks.zh: 一不小心就成了全桌的笑谈。
chunks.en: I would easily become the laughing stock of the table.

chunks.zh: 还好，我家人、朋友、同事都不碰烟酒，除了偶尔要应付一些领导的饭局，基本都没机会接触烟酒🐶
chunks.en: Fortunately, my family, friends, and colleagues don't touch tobacco or alcohol. Except for occasionally dealing with some leaders' dinners, I basically have no chance to be exposed to tobacco or alcohol 🐶

chunks.zh: 说去敬的你们是没碰上拿个大点的杯子给你倒酒，每个人必须喝完的。
chunks.en: Those of you who are told to make a toast probably haven't encountered people pouring wine into a large glass for you, and everyone must finish it.

chunks.zh: 肚子要炸都得喝
chunks.en: You have to drink it even if your stomach is about to explode.

chunks.zh: 简直噩梦，还好我没有这种经历，要么就是我跑得快
chunks.en: It's a nightmare. Fortunately, I haven't had this experience, or I run fast.

chunks.zh: 服从性测试啊 职场也有
chunks.en: A compliance test, the workplace has those too

chunks.zh: 幸好我的长辈们聚餐时不爱喝酒
chunks.en: Fortunately, my elders don't like to drink at gatherings.
